channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: 2 arrested in drug bust; $410,000 worth of drugs seized
item.description:
September 04, 2020 4:16 PM

SINGAPORE - A bust on Thursday (Sept 3) saw drugs worth about $410,000 seized, and the recovery of weapons like knives and a baseball bat.

item.title: 40 new Covid-19 patients in Singapore, including 3 imported; no cases in the community
item.description:
September 04, 2020 4:12 PM

SINGAPORE - There were 40 new coronavirus cases confirmed as of Friday noon (Sept 4), taking Singapore's total to 56,948.

item.title: Volunteers on watch for crime while riding public transport
item.description:
September 04, 2020 3:48 PM

SINGAPORE - Unlike many other commuters who are glued to their phones while on public transport, undergraduate Valerie Lee,19 and her brother Nicholas, 22, keep an eye out for trouble when commuting.

item.title: Man accused of murdering wife in Boon Lay to be remanded for psychiatric observation
item.description:
September 04, 2020 12:31 PM

SINGAPORE - A man charged with murdering his wife in Boon Lay will be remanded for psychiatric observation.

item.title: SingPost, MOE launch superhero-themed stamp set in tribute to teachers
item.description:
September 04, 2020 12:10 PM

SINGAPORE - SingPost, in collaboration with the Ministry of Education, has launched a new stamp set featuring a superhero squad that educates students on how they can protect themselves against Covid-19.

item.title: Maid acquitted of stealing over $34k worth of items from Changi Airport Group chairman Liew Mun Leong's home
item.description:
September 04, 2020 11:24 AM

The judge found that the family had "improper motives" and wanted to stop her from going to the authorities.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Sept 4
item.description:
September 04, 2020 7:48 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Friday, Sept 4.

item.title: Duo accused of child's murder further remanded
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Two people who allegedly killed four-year-old Megan Khung Yu Wai will be further remanded after appearing in a district court yesterday.

item.title: Court upholds order to sell ex-SSC president's house
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

The Court of Appeal has upheld an order for a house, owned by now-bankrupt former Singapore Swimming Club (SSC) president Freddie Koh and his wife, to be sold to pay off his debts of about $3.2 million.

item.title: More access to career guidance for JC, secondary school students
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Students in secondary schools and junior colleges will have greater access to career guidance from next year to help them better handle the fast-changing education and jobs landscape.

item.title: Firm under probe after discharge seen in Sungei Kadut river
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

A company is under probe after white discharge in a river in Sungei Kadut was traced to its factory in the area.

item.title: Deadlier than Covid-19: Consider Disease X as a serious threat, say experts
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Disease X, a new unknown disease that could cause a future epidemic, will be highly infectious, deadlier than Covid-19 and will mutate easily, said local health experts.

item.title: Singapore remains Asia-Pacific's most innovative nation
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

For the seventh consecutive year, Singapore has retained the top spot as Asia-Pacific's most innovative nation in the latest Global Innovation Index.

item.title: Covid-19 testing for groups in S’pore a good move, but better to keep it voluntary: Experts
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

The latest move by the Government to expand Covid-19 testing to community groups is a good strategy to catch asymptomatic infections, Professor Teo Yik Ying, dean of the National University of Singapore's (NUS) Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health, said yesterday.

item.title: HDB resale prices rise at fastest rate since February
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Sales of Housing Board resale flats remained strong last month, with five units changing hands for at least $1 million, as prices grew at the fastest monthly rate since February.

item.title: Nex, VivoCity, Suntec City among places visited by patients
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Several malls - Nex, VivoCity and Suntec City - were among the new places visited by infectious Covid-19 patients, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday.

item.title: Coroner issues open verdict in case of baby's death
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

A three-month-old baby died after his mother found him unconscious on a bed in February 2018. He had shared the same bed as her.

item.title: Girl was riding fixed-gear bicycle before falling to death from multi-storey carpark
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

A girl who fell to her death in January at a multi-storey carpark was riding her friend's fixed-gear bicycle down a slope in the building, police investigations revealed.

item.title: Top honour for teacher who took CCA to new heights
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

In the past decade, the boys in the water polo co-curricular activity (CCA) at Outram Secondary School have made a name for themselves in the sport, beating traditional powerhouses like Anglo-Chinese School (Independent).

item.title: School is a draw for ex-convict, 45, with teachers' support
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

At age 45, Mr Rahman Sanip stands out among his teenage coursemates pursuing a fine arts diploma at Lasalle College of the Arts.

item.title: IPPT, ICT for NSmen to resume progressively from October
item.description:
September 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Individual physical proficiency tests (IPPT) and in-camp training (ICT) for operationally ready national servicemen (NSmen) will resume progressively from next month, said the Ministry of Defence (Mindef) yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore to work with G-20 and global organisations to restart international travel
item.description:
September 04, 2020 12:15 AM

SINGAPORE - The Republic will work with the Group of 20 (G-20) countries and international organisations to look into the gradual restart of cross-border travel, said Foreign Minister Vivian Balakrishnan on Thursday (Sept 3).
